required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Participation of Manual Wheelchair Users in the Community
clinical_study.official_title: Participation of Manual Wheelchair Users in the Community: The Relationship to Wheelchair Skills Capacity

brief_summary.textblock:
To explore the relationship between ability to do different wheelchair skills and the participation and quality of life of wheelchair users in and around their home and community. The investigators study hypothesis:
1. Self-reported capacity of wheelchair skills (ability to do wheelchair skills) is strongly related to self-reported participation.
2. Self-reported capacity of wheelchair skills (ability to do wheelchair skills) is related to the average daily distance traveled in their wheelchair.

primary_outcome.measure: Wheelchair Skills Test Questionnaire Capacity Version
primary_outcome.description: Participants will be asked if they can perform 32 skills from the WST 4.1 (capacity)using a structured interview approach. A skill will be considered a pass if done describing a safe manner.

primary_outcome.measure: Impact on Participation and Autonomy Questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: This measure addresses autonomy with respect to activities and participation, and is a self-report measure.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to a week time period, one time measure
primary_outcome.description: The average distance treavelled per day over a week in the participant's wheelchair will be measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale short form

arm_group.description: People who have a wheelchair for home and community use.

study_pop.textblock: Community sample of people who use manual wheelchairs
